intro: Myrsine papuana, commonly known as the Papuan myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Pacific islands, particularly New Guinea and the Solomon Islands. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, white to pink flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, fleshy berries. Myrsine papuana is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
